title: X-Wing
description: When a candidate appears in exactly two cells in each of two rows (same columns), it can be eliminated from other cells in those columns.

steps.title: What is an X-Wing?
steps.content: An X-Wing is a pattern where a candidate digit appears in exactly two cells in each of two different rows, and these cells align on the same two columns. The four cells form a rectangle, and the digit can be eliminated from other cells in those two columns.

steps.title: Visualize the rectangle
steps.content: Imagine four cells at the corners of a rectangle. In row A, digit 4 can only go in columns 2 and 7. In row B, digit 4 can also only go in columns 2 and 7. These four cells form an X-Wing.

steps.title: The logic
steps.content: In row A, digit 4 must go in column 2 or column 7. In row B, digit 4 must also go in column 2 or column 7. There are only two possible arrangements: either 4 goes in A2 and B7, or 4 goes in A7 and B2.

steps.title: Either way, the columns are covered
steps.content: In both possible arrangements, columns 2 and 7 each have a 4 placed in them (from one of our two rows). This means no other cell in columns 2 or 7 can contain a 4.

steps.title: Eliminate from the columns
steps.content: Remove the digit 4 from all other cells in columns 2 and 7 (excluding the four X-Wing cells). This can unblock cells that were stuck.

steps.title: X-Wing on columns
steps.content: The same pattern works with columns instead of rows. If a digit appears in exactly two cells in each of two columns, and those cells share the same two rows, eliminate that digit from other cells in those rows.

steps.title: How to find X-Wings
steps.content: For each digit, check every row. If a digit has exactly two candidate cells in a row, note the column positions. If another row has the same digit restricted to the same two columns, you've found an X-Wing.

steps.title: Why it's called X-Wing
steps.content: If you draw lines connecting the four cells diagonally, they form an X shape â€” hence the name. X-Wings are rare but powerful, and they're the gateway to even more advanced fish patterns like Swordfish.
